H0.text: A 'Tope', also known as a 'Stupa', is a domed structure erected as a burial place in which religion. Hindu

H1.text: A 'Tope', also known as a 'Stupa', is a domed structure erected as a burial place in which religion. Jain

H2.text: A 'Tope', also known as a 'Stupa', is a domed structure erected as a burial place in which religion. Sikh

H3.text: A 'Tope', also known as a 'Stupa', is a domed structure erected as a burial place in which religion. Buddh

A4.text: In Buddhism, a stupa (Sanskrit: स्तूप, lit. 'heap', IAST: stūpa) is a domed hemispherical structure containing several types of sacred relics, including images, statues, metals, and śarīra—the remains of Buddhist monks or nuns.

A5.text: After his parinirvana, Buddha's remains were cremated and the ashes divided and buried under eight mounds, with two further mounds encasing the urn and the embers.
